title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Monroe College (Bronx, NY) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, great communication, very professional, direct and to the point. A follow-up email was sent the next day. My questions for the next step were answered within 24 hours. Everything was easy to understand and easy to follow.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Monroe College (Bronx, NY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application and resume, the hiring team reviewed my documents to evaluate my qualifications, work experience, and relevant skills. I was then called for an interview Initial Screening In-Person or Video Interview Behavioral and Situational Questions Technical Skills Assessment Personality and Cultural Fit References and Background Checks
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your experience as an administrative assistant. What interests you about working as an administrative assistant in our company? How do you prioritize and handle multiple tasks with competing deadlines? Can you provide an example of a time when you had to handle a difficult or demanding client or coworker? How did you manage the situation? How do you ensure accuracy and attention to detail in your work? Describe your experience in managing calendars, scheduling appointments, and coordinating meetings. What software or tools are you proficient in using for administrative tasks? How do you handle confidential or sensitive information in the workplace? Give an example of a time when you had to solve a problem independently and explain the steps you took to resolve it. How do you handle interruptions and unexpected changes to your daily tasks or schedule? Describe your approach to maintaining effective communication with team members and managers.

title: Accounting Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Monroe College (New Rochelle, NY) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview seemed rushed, it only lasted about 15 minutes. Met with two directors, one of them had to leave in the middle of the interview. I was able to answer all of the questions that they asked but they just didn't seem interactive.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Monroe College (New York, NY) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process was very straightforward and contextual very relevant.  Also, balance, equitable, and to the point.  It also was interesting and in tandem with today's interviewing processes.   The panel was balanced and the goals and objectives were clearly defined and relevant
Interview Questions: Customer Care management to ensure a good outcome

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Monroe College in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was short, sweet and simple. I met with the department and then with the President. The initial interview was a group interview with everyone from the department.
Interview Questions: They asked the basic questions about prior experience.

title: Graduate Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Monroe College (Bronx, NY) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had two rounds of interviews. First Round was a quick 30 mins chat with the head of graduate admission department in queens. It proceeded to the second round of interview the following week.  For the second round interview, I had 4 individual interviews with different department heads (President,VP, HR and Deans).
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experiences

title: Writing Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Monroe College
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by director who asked me about my past experience, where I attended college, etc. Was asked questions regarding diversity and working with lower level academic students. Was asked questions regarding my interest in working at monroe and how long I intended to stay, etc.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student is behaving disrespectfully?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Monroe College (New York, NY) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Good at first but quickly turned inappropriate. I only took the job offer because I had no clue what I was going to be in for when I actually worked here. Wish I did my research before hand. Hope this helps people considering this horrible place
Interview Questions: Are you married? Do you have children?

title: Accounting Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Monroe College (Bronx, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I attended a few workshops at the school. It was there I started to network with people. I go noticed and was called on the phone for a phone interview which lasted 15 minutes. I was then extended the opportunity for a on-site interview which lasted an hour. I met with the advisers and other accounting professors. It was very average.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
What are your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Front Desk Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Monroe College (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very profession. They reviewed my application extensively and then invited me in to the interview. Ensure that you know a lot about the company in order to increase your chances of getting an offer.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work within Monroe College?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Monroe College (New Rochelle, NY) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: There are 2 faculty members who interview you and ask you about what you want to teach. Very friendly and also understand where you come from. However you have to volunteer for one semester before you can be paid.
Interview Questions: How do you think you can benefit us?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Monroe College (Bronx, NY) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview initially in group setting, then with director and eventually met with the president of the college.  It was a pleasant process. The job was student focused which was a positive coming from a high school working with kids.
Interview Questions: Where did I see myself in 5 years?

title: Senior Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Monroe College
Interview Descriptions: Lots of questions about loyalty, loyalty, loyalty. They want to know how long you are going to stick around.
Interview Questions: Where do see yourself with this company in the new few years. Usually easy, but for them you must lie and glow about the college, or they will not hire you.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Monroe College (Bronx, NY) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to present a demo lesson.  During this time, I had 15 minutes to teach a lesson.  I was encouraged to make it as engaging as possible.  At the end of the demo, I was asked a few questions, and was sent on my way. The next day, I received a call telling me I was hired.
Interview Questions: "What is your experience with working with urban students?"

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Monroe College (New York, NY) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Many years ago very focused on my skills
Work background 
How I taught Developmental Writing
Work schedule 
Family life courses I would be interested in teaching hours I was interested in teaching 
Spoke about the culture of the school
Interview Questions: What are some of my strengths in the classroom

title: Financial Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Monroe College (Bronx, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: You meet with almost everyone in the departments ending with the President. If you make it to him then you're a viable candidate. Make sure to research the school history and mission statement.
Interview Questions: Do you have children? Are you planning to have any? Are you married?

title: Financial Aid Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Monroe College (Bronx, NY) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: It felt like an interview for a government entity. The interview lasted hours and included meetings with almost everyone in the financial aid office, upper management and the college president.
Interview Questions:
Do you know the history of the school?
Why do you want to work here?
Do you know anyone working here already?
What salarycwould you like earn over the course of your career?
Why should we hire you?
How would you handle situations where you don't have any solutions?

title: Senior Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Monroe College (Bronx, NY) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was not a bad experience.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions

title: Admissions Recruiters Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Monroe College (New York, NY) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and got a phone call about a month or two later. I had a brief phone interview with HR and they asked to bring me in for a 1:1. I met with an HR person first. Next I met with the Dean of Students and the Dean of Admissions, All on different dates
Interview Questions: Would you be able to speak to a group of students parents that only speak Spanish and convince them in Spanish to attend Monroe?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Monroe College (New Rochelle, NY) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: They asked me to complete an online quiz,  and I met with the VP and Dean.  They asked me to come back and meet with another VP,  who asked some inappropriate questions regarding my marital status, age, and social life.  I came backa few more times to meet with various people.  I didnt meet my direct supervisor until my last interview,  and I didnt meet those I would be working directly with until my first day of work.
Interview Questions: What Do you know about the college?

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Monroe College (New Rochelle, NY) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was what you would expect
Interview Questions: why are you applying
